p: Cutaneous ulcerations, or sickle cell ulcers, manifest mostly as distal leg ulcers around the malleoli, areas with thin skin and small amounts of subcutaneous fat. [ 3] Sickle leg ulcers have a complex and partially understood etiology with a prevalence of 8% to 10% in North America.
